summary: This document is an email chain between Audrey Strauss and an unnamed sender regarding draft press remarks and Q&A materials for Ghislaine Maxwell. The emails discuss edits to simplify language and shorten sentences in preparation for a potential press conference.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Recipient and sender in email chain discussing draft press materials for Ghislaine Maxwell; appears to be reviewing and providing feedback on the remarks.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The press remarks and Q&A being drafted are about her; she is the central figure the press conference would address.

connections.description: Strauss, as a US Attorney, is involved in preparing press materials related to Maxwell, indicating a prosecutorial or official legal interest.

events.title: Draft Press Materials Prepared
events.description: Draft remarks and Q&A for a potential press conference about Ghislaine Maxwell were prepared and sent for review.

events.title: Email Exchange on Edits
events.description: Audrey Strauss acknowledges receipt of draft press materials; subsequent email on June 28 provides edits to simplify language and shorten sentences.

events.title: Edits Submitted on Press Remarks
events.description: An email with attached edited version of Ghislaine Maxwell press remarks is sent, focusing on simplifying language and shortening sentences.

keyFacts: Audrey Strauss, a US Attorney, was actively involved in reviewing and editing press materials related to Ghislaine Maxwell in June 2020.
A potential press conference about Ghislaine Maxwell was being planned for the week following June 28, 2020.
The draft materials included press remarks and a Q&A document, indicating preparation for public statements by officials.
The edits focused on simplifying language and shortening sentences, suggesting careful crafting of public messaging.
